page.title: 02Natural History In The Area.
page.content: We went bird-watching along Salary Brook and through Welshwood Park. On the way we saw the following birds: chaffinch, wren, crow, pigeon, jay, dunnock, yellow-hammer, robin, rook, mistle-thrush, song-thrush, great spotted woodpecker, blackbird, red-legged partridge, pheasant, lesser black-backed gull, kestrel and linnet. {Bullock Wood}is between Ipswich Road and Ardleigh Road. It contains many different trees such as silver birches and sweet chestnuts. There are also foxes, grey squirrels and many birds, including blackbirds, robins and jays. A long path circles inside the wood, so if you stay on it you will not become lost. However, when walking through, boots and trousers should be worn, as there large banks of nettles. Beautiful flowers grow there, such as bluebells and mouse-eared hawkweed.
